title: Update to v3.1.15 ERASED ALL of my previous email (Ubuntu)

sentences.text: User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Ubuntu;
Linux i686;
rv:8.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/8.0
Steps to reproduce:
Nothing, Linux system applied the automatic update of Thunderbird ver 3.1.15, I didn't do anything, did not create a new profile nor setup any new server nor file folders.
I expected this 'release' to behave, my mistake.
This release should NEVER had been pushed out of BETA.

It's obnoxious to think this repeating problem thru multiple Thunderbird releases still exists and is the utter doom for those with hundreds of emails in your Inbox that are not achived or safely stored where a MAJOR BUG ridden upgrade wouldn't be able to erase/delete/vanish them.
Actual results:
Immediately ALL of my Inbox Emails vanished.

I have read on the dozens of reports relating to this problem from previous versions and users, thus far and hours later I have been utterly unable to repair the problem and regain hundreds of emails that without warning, prompts or alerts of any kind suddenly vanished when the newest Thunderbird upgrade was applied.
Expected results:
Obviously ANY POSSIBLE way a email program erases/deletes/vanishes ALL the Inbox existing emails upon installation should never had been released as a upgrade/update.
Looking thru my profile feature, it appears unchanged.
The ONLY change that appears is the absolute vanishing act on hundreds of emails in my Inbox.

After several hours of searching, looking at various features, reading dozens of upset former Thunderbird users with a similar complaint I haven't been able to resolve this incredible bad BUG in the newest release by Thunderbird for Linux systems.
(In reply to ASmith from comment #0)
> Nothing, Linux system applied the automatic update of Thunderbird ver > 3.1.15,
Please contact your distribution (and their bugtracker) in that case if data migration did not work out.

Please also tell us your exact distribution, plus way more information what "erased all my previous mail" actually means, e.g. what kind of account this is about (POP, IMAP, ...), and which folders this refers to.
Do not compact any folder!

Your emails may still be there, look into the files where the mailboxes are stored (e.g. $HOME/.thunderbird/<profile..>/Mail/<accountname>/* If you find the data back up the whole directory somewhere safe.
Then delete Inbox.msf (or other folder which was supposedly lost) and start Thunderbird.

There are dozens or reports of sudden email erasure,deletion,loss upon upgrading,installation over many releases and versions PREVIOUSLY spanning well over 1 year on the net for anyone to lookup and see.
Obviously for some totally unexplained nor evident reason, the following suggested essential coding needs to be included for all Thunderbird releases:

1) At the very beginning of the Installation/Upgrading Software Code, the Profiles and Inbox Emails files must be set by the installer for the attribute of READ-ONLY avoiding any and all possible total data loss which has been plaguing Thunderbird for a really unreasonably long period of time.

2) At the very end of the Installation/Upgrading Software Code, the Profiles and Inbox Emails files should have their attributes reset back to what they were originally from the temporary READ-ONLY during installation.

3) ALL Current Thunderbird Email Users should be instructed to create a email Folder and copy ALL of their emails in their INBOX to that folder BEFORE upgrading their Thunderbird software to lessen any possibility of those emails being Erased/Deleted/Vanishing.
Back to this thread...
All of the previous Emails in the Thunderbird 'INBOX' were Erased/Deleted/Vanished upon upgrading to Thunderbird version 3.1.15 on this Linux box.
The Emails stored in other folders I had created as well as those 'Sent', 'Archived' were not affected.

I would strongly urge all existing Thunderbird Users to either backup all of their emails and their Thunderbird Folders (major finger down the users throats as well as a major security risk which must also be addressed), or in the very least copy all of your INBOX emails to a user created Folder PRIOR to any upgrades of the Thunderbird Software to lessen any possibility of all of your INBOX emails being Erased/Deleted/Vanishing upon installing the upgrade.
Locking the existing emails and profiles via changing their file attributes to READ-ONLY should have been in the Thunderbird Installation top of the code long ago.
The long running reports across the NET outlining the very same problem I encountered NOW, spanning over several years is a very large turn-off to possible new Thunderbird users.
My advise is to immediately add that essential coding to all further Thunderbird releases in the future which should end this problem dead in it's tracks.
I have not compacted any of the Thunderbird folders prior nor since the Thunderbird upgrade release 3.1.15 Erased/Deleted/Vanished all of my 100's previous emails in my INBOX.
